content.description:
Where to begin with this one! This climb has a somewhat sordid history. For an informative description of the many versions of Mangler, be sure to check out the entry in the paper guidebook. 

  Climb down into the small pit and start on both sides of the block. Climb up and out of the pit.
content.protection: 2-3 pads. There are some back breaking boulders around so be careful.

content.description: Start at the bottom of the pit with a RH sloper and a LH gaston on a good crimp. Make a few easy moves, then enter the crux by reaching out to a horrible LH crimp and continuing up to the lip via a bad right hand pinch. After hitting the lip, climb up the relatively easy slab to the top of the boulder.
content.protection: 3-4 pads. The landing rises as you climb higher, but there are many large rocks that need to be covered. The topout is also somewhat high, so pads are needed outside of the pit as well.

content.description:
Its a shame this line doesnt get more traffic. This is a great v4 with some very interesting and crimpy moves.  

  Find the vertical seam of the south facing face (see topo picture). Start with a high diagonal crimp and climb up on crimpy sidepulls. Find the faint gully like feature of the rock that appears when the sidepulls run out. High step up and press up onto the top section of the boulder.
content.protection: 2 pads. Good landing, but a bit scrunched by the tree.

content.description: Slabby jug haul. Follow the prominent crack up the slab. Careful as the landing has a bad ramp that would surely ruin an ankle or two!
content.protection: 2 pads (if youre able). The ramp at the bottom makes it rather difficult to keep your pads in place. Best bet is just say a prayer and dont look back once you start up!
content.location: This boulder is adjacent to Big.

content.description: Climb the big zig zagging crack system
content.protection: 2 pads. Due to ground boulders, may be somewhat tricky to pad

content.description: Find the massive wave like boulder just near the Mangler. Starting on nice crimps in the middle of this boulder, climb up and right towards the off-width that is formed by the adjacent boulder. Enter into the off-width and finish it up!
content.protection: 2-3 pads and a good spotter. You gain elevation quickly with this one.
content.location: From the Mangler, turn and face uphill. You'll see the massive 4-Leaf Clover boulder. Head for the slab and then slip around the left side to come face to face with the wave-like boulder that contains Big!

content.description:
Looking for somewhere thats slightly off the beaten path yet extremely simple to find (given that you know how to get to The Caves!) Head over to the Big Area and make your way around the many boulders that make up this section.  

  This area is often overlooked and its evident on the amount of growth slowly taking over the boulders. Make sure you take a good brush (or two) with you if The Big Area is on your agenda.
